title: Wrap SkPath Iter class. (#68)
body: This allows for iterating over SKPaths. See also https://github.com/mono/skia/pull/10

comments.author: xamarin-cla-bot
comments.body:
Hey @tdenniston,
Thank you for your Pull Request! We <3 our contributors!

However, it looks like you haven't signed our CLA (Contributor License Agreement) yet. In order for us to accept your pull request, you have to sign our CLA first.
Once you do this, we can check over your pull request. You should only have to do this once.

You can read and sign our full Contributor License Agreement [here](https://cla.xamarin.com).

Thanks,

Your friendly Xamarin CLA Bot#

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: @tdenniston, thanks for the PR! I'll have a look at it soon. Have you signed the CLA yet?

comments.author: tdenniston
comments.body: @mattleibow I haven't signed it yet, I'm still trying to figure that one out. I'm not sure I'm comfortable with a bot having admin access to my Github organizations, as those are tied to my professional life (these contributions are personal). I contacted Github support and there doesn't seem to be a way to disallow the bot access to my organizations. I may end up creating a new Github account for my professional work so that this can remain separate. If you want this PR but can't merge it until I sign the CLA, let me know and I'll expedite that process.

comments.author: bholmes
comments.body: @tdenniston we have fixed the cla bot to not request those roles.  You should be able to sign now with no worries.

comments.author: migueldeicaza
comments.body: Any updates on getting the CLA signed?

comments.author: tdenniston
comments.body: @migueldeicaza I'm just waiting to hear from our technology licensing office, I'm not sure what's taking so long. I will ask them for an update. But in the meantime, I won't be offended if you want to reimplement this functionality and close this PR.

comments.author: migueldeicaza
comments.body:
No problem!

I ended up adding both SKPath::Iter and SKPath::RawIter support, as they offer slightly different feature sets.   Would love if you could check them out.
